Cittaka Thera：Son of a wealthy brahmin of Rājagaha．He heard the Buddha preach at Veluvana and，having entered the Order，practised meditation in a wooded spot，ultimately achieving arahantship.

In the time of Vipassī Buddha he offered him flowers in homage （Thag.22； ThagA.i.77）.

He is probably identical with Tīnikinkinipupphiya Thera of the Apadāna．Ap.ii.433.
